name: depositSwitchTokenCreate
description: In order for the end user to take action, you will need to create a public token representing the deposit switch. This token is used to initialize Link. It can be used one time and expires after 30 minutes.

DepositSwitchTokenCreateRequest.description: DepositSwitchTokenCreateRequest defines the request schema for `/deposit_switch/token/create`

deposit_switch_id.description: The ID of the deposit switch

APIClientID.description: Your Plaid API `client_id`. The `client_id` is required and may be provided either in the `PLAID-CLIENT-ID` header or as part of a request body.
APIClientID.title: ClientID

APISecret.description: Your Plaid API `secret`. The `secret` is required and may be provided either in the `PLAID-SECRET` header or as part of a request body.
APISecret.title: APISecret

$block: DepositSwitchTokenCreateResponse defines the response schema for `/deposit_switch/token/create`

$ul: **deposit_switch_token**: Deposit switch token, used to initialize Link for the Deposit Switch product
**deposit_switch_token_expiration_time**: Expiration time of the token, in [ISO 8601](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format
**request_id**: A unique identifier for the request, which can be used for troubleshooting. This identifier, like all Plaid identifiers, is case sensitive.
